questions: Which meristem leads to growth in length?
answers: The meristematic regions that arises from root apical meristems are: (i) Protoderm, (ii) Procambium, (iii) Ground meristerm.

questions: From where does the lateral root originate?
answers: Pericycle of mature zone.

questions: Name the tissues which provides mechanical strength to the plant organs.
answers: Sclerenchyma tissues.

questions: What is conjunctive tissue?
answers: It is a narrow strip of tissue (parenchyma or sclerenchyma) that lies between xylem and phloem bundles of root.

questions: What is the economic use of phloem fibres?
answers: They are used for making threads, ropes and coarse textiles.

questions: Name the tissue represented by the jute fibres that are used for making the ropes.
answers: Bast fibre (Phloem fibre).

questions: What are stomata?
answers: Minute pores present on the surface of leaves are called stomata. They are meant for exchange of gases.

questions: What are cotton fibres?
answers: Cotton fibres are unicellular epidermal hair of seed of Gossypium sps.

questions: What is a bark?
answers: Bark is the dead tissue, lying outside the cork cambium.

questions: Define promeristem.
answers: It is a part of apical meristem made up of actively dividing cells and their immediate derivatives.

questions: Why is the root apical meristem sub-terminal?
answers: Root apical meristem is sub-terminal because of the presence of a protective terminal root cap over it.

questions: Name two types of parenchyma present in leaf?
answers: Palisade and spongy parenchyma.

questions: Name the cells that surround vascular bundles in dicot leaf.
answers: Vascular bundles are surrounded by a bundle sheath of parenchymatous cells.

questions: Define calyptrogen.
answers: It is a special meristematic region at the end of the root that given rise to cap.

questions: What is quiescent centre?
answers: It is a small region with low mitotic activity in the centre of the root apex.

questions: What are casparian strips?
answers: These are the thickenings of lignin and suberin formed around the anticlinal walls of endodermis to prevent plasmolysis.

questions: What is an annual ring?
answers: It is also called growth ring. A single growth ring formed each year is called annual ring.

questions: What is the function of cock in plants?
answers: Cork insulates the tree against heat and cold.

questions: When do you refer a vascular bundle as a closed bundle?
answers: When cambium is absent.

questions: What forms the cambial ring in a dicot stem during the secondary growth?
answers: Fascicular and interfascicular strips of meristems.

questions: What are collateral vascular bundles?
answers: Conjoint bundles with xylem towards the inner side and phloem towards the outer side.

questions: Name the plant I which bicollateral vascular bundles are found.
answers: Cucurbita maxima (Kaddu).

questions: What are the cells included in a stele?
answers: The cells included in a stele are Pericycle, vascular strands and pith.

questions: What is the function of pith cells?
answers: Pith cells store food in the form of starch.

questions: What is Lysogineous cavity?
answers: In a mature vascular bundle, some of the protoxylem vessels and the xylem parenchyma cells dissolve or separate to form a water containing cavity Lysogineous cavity.
